The town of Farmington, West Virginia, near the Pennsylvania border, has never forgotten the coal mine disaster there in 1968.
At 5:30 in the morning on November 20th, a huge explosion tore through Consolidation Coal's Number Nine mine.
The force of the blast could be felt for miles.
There would be dozens of other explosions in the days to come and intense fires.
Ninety-nine miners were underground at the time; 21 managed to make it to the surface, the other 78 all died.
Nineteen bodies were never recovered.
